segments.narrationText: Meeting Highlights is a new Microsoft Teams feature that delivers a dynamic, bite-sized video recap of your meeting.
It uses AI to automatically generate a short highlights video, typically 3 to 5 minutes long.
The feature combines AI-generated voiceover summaries with authentic video snippets from the actual meeting.
This preserves the original tone, reactions, and flow of the discussion.
It solves a critical problem: catching up on missed meetings without watching hour-long recordings or reading lengthy transcripts.
Let me show you how to access Meeting Highlights through BizChat.
Open BizChat and ask it to recap a specific meeting.
You can reference specific meetings using Contextual Instant Query by typing slash.
This opens a menu to select and search for meetings to add to your message.
BizChat will return a reply to your query and a video player with the meeting highlights appears at the bottom.
Note: If the meeting is a series meeting, BizChat currently won't show the highlights player yet.
We're working on additional ways to surface highlights via BizChat and Teams.
Meeting Highlights delivers three key benefits to users.
First, massive time savings. Instead of watching a 60-minute recording, catch up in 3 to 5 minutes.
Second, better engagement and retention through audiovisual content that caters to all learning styles.
Third, preserved meeting dynamics. You get the tone and vibe of discussions, not just facts.
Internal users have called it magical, with one manager saying it saved hours of reviewing transcripts.
Meeting Highlights brings together six Microsoft teams in a cross-organizational collaboration.
ODSP handles storage and orchestration, initiating highlights generation when recordings are created.
MSAI-Hive processes meeting transcripts using Large Language Model technology to generate highlight content.
Clipchamp owns the highlights player component, delivering the visual playback experience.
Loop enables seamless embedding of the Clipchamp player within different application surfaces.
BizChat provides the primary user interface with natural language access to highlights.
Teams delivers highlights within the Teams ecosystem, sharing the same player technology via Loop.
Together, these teams deliver a unified user experience that showcases true Microsoft collaboration.
Let me walk you through the architecture behind Meeting Highlights.
It starts when a Teams meeting ends and a recording exists.
ODSP, our storage and orchestration layer, detects the recording and initiates the highlight generation process.
The TMR processor retrieves the meeting transcript and calls our LLM.
The LLM analyzes the transcript and returns structured metadata describing the highlights.
Azure Cognitive Services then converts the narration text into audio using text-to-speech.
Finally, all the metadata, audio, and captions are securely stored in ODSP and made available through BizChat and Teams.
Meeting Highlights combines two distinct types of highlights to create a comprehensive recap.
First, abstractive highlights. These are AI-generated summaries that capture the key topics discussed in the meeting.
Second, key moments. These are significant verbatim segments extracted directly from the meeting recording.
Each highlight is a 20 to 30 second segment with precise timestamps and accompanying narration.
The narration text is converted to natural-sounding audio using Azure Cognitive Services text-to-speech.
All the metadata, audio files, and caption data are securely stored in ODSP.
Making highlights available across Microsoft 365 platforms wherever users work.
Cost efficiency while maintaining quality is critical for scaling meeting highlights globally.
The initial implementation required 4 sequential LLM calls per meeting, creating significant computational costs.
We collapsed the four-step pipeline into one unified prompt with leaner input.
Dedicated tuning preserved the original algorithm as an internal reasoning chain: segment, extract, rank, compose.
We also optimized input tokens by switching from verbose JSON to compact schema and eliminating pre-computed candidate ranges.
The impact: 75% fewer model invocations per meeting, and 60% reduction in input tokens.
Estimated GPU requirements drop from 600 to 200 for global availability.
Combined, this is estimated to cut COGS by over 70%, enabling economically viable worldwide rollout.
The unified prompt produces higher-quality highlights that internal reviewers strongly prefer over the multi-prompt version.
These improvements unblock private preview and enable general availability within capacity constraints.
Meeting Highlights has received overwhelmingly positive feedback in recent MS Elite surveys.
More than 80 percent of users rated Meeting Highlights as extremely useful or very useful.
96 percent shared that they are very likely or likely to use the feature again.
This points to strong product-market fit and daily habit formation among our users.
Users have shared enthusiastic feedback about Meeting Highlights.
Kevin C. commented: "Love this feature. Great way to catch up on a recap without watching the full thing."
Ryan Roslonsky added: "Beyond the awesome text recap, there is literally a two-minute narrated video about the meeting."
"It's mind-blowing and an engaging way to recap a meeting for a richer understanding of the conversation."
Another user shared: "Saved me hours of reviewing the transcript. This is magical."
Based on user feedback, we have an exciting roadmap ahead.
Users want more detailed and specific highlights that capture nuanced discussions.
Deeper integration with Teams Recap for seamless access to highlights.
Including action items and decisions to make highlights more actionable.
And additional language support to serve our global user base.
These improvements are on our roadmap as we work toward general availability in 2024.
